result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer M. Shelby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Restitution is ordered in the amount of $6049.00 to be paid to the Franklin PTA organization.

*Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
*Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages, if revoked, any balance as a condition of ES. To be paid by the end of probation.   If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

*Defendant advised that she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
*Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Hold no positions as a trustee of money.

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: *As a condition of probation, the Court ordered defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction. FORTHWITH.  Huber release privileges for work and treatment only.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jennifer M. Shelby in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Debbie G. and Jill W.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 months.

The Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years.  

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction. FORTHWITH.  Huber release privileges for work and treatment only.  
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Hold no positions as a trustee of money.  
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $6049.00 to be paid to the Franklin PTA organization.  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages, if revoked, any balance as a condition of ES. To be paid by the end of probation.   If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Telephone call from attorney Mary Garvin Guimont regarding upcoming sentencing hearing.  At the last court date, both parties were not in court.  The sentencing is scheduled for March 22, 2016 and Attorney Garvin Guimont indicates she was given March 23, 2016.  The Court does have availability on March 23, 2016.  Case calendared for sentencing on March 23, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.  Confirming email to parties.

Defendant Jennifer M. Shelby in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause for Mary Garvin Guimont.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for Bruce Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing.  Defense counsel is unavailable for today's proceedings.  Defense counsel requests new date.    Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jennifer M. Shelby in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  James C. Griffin for Bruce Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
Letter from ADA Landgraf with plea agreement, filed.

Defendant Jennifer M. Shelby in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Court is in trial.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea date.    Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jennifer M. Shelby in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Bruce Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties need additional time for negotiations and request an adjournment.   Court ordered case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jennifer M. Shelby in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Bruce Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Projected guilty plea hearing.  Defendant not feeling well.  Defense counsel requests new date.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jennifer M. Shelby in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-18-2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Jennifer M. Shelby in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jennifer M. Shelby in court. Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared telephonically.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant Jennifer M. Shelby in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT MISSING COURT FILE.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  (First available Scheduling Date agreed upon by both parties.)  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jennifer M. Shelby in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 1/27/15 @ 1 PM
